Nov 20, 2016 / Tokyo, Minato-ku

Ukraine DAY 2016

Ukrainian Festival is over. Thank you for attending and we hope to see you next year!

Facebook Event Page

Announcement

We invite everyone on November 20th to join us at the Third Ukrainian Festival "Ukraine in our Hearts" that will take place in Kanto, Tokyo. Doors open from 11:30 AM to 5:00 PM. Everyone can learn something new about Ukraine and its culture, try delicious Ukrainian food, participate in master classes of making "Vybiika", "Pysanka", Easter eggs or Ukrainian embroidery.

When: Nov 20, 2016 / 11:30 AM - 5:00 PM
Where: Tokyo, Minato-ku, Akasaka 4-18-13, Akasaka Kumin Hall
Entry fee: FREE / Some workshops may require participation fees

Organizers and participants:

  • Ukrainian Community in Japan "Kraiany"
  • Ukrainian embassy in Japan
  • Ukrainian School "Dzherelce"

Supported by:

  • Minato-ku Akasaka Kumin Centre
  • Mission of Ukrainian Orthodox Church - Kyiv Patriarchate
  • Buratino Store
  • ROSHEN

When: Nov 20, 2016

Where: Akasaka Kumin Hall

Entry fee: FREE

Live Performance

Ukrainian Cuisine Restaurant

11:30 AM - 3:00 PM

Exhibition and Workshop Experience

Workshops of traditional crafts
Photo exhibition
Exhibition and raffle of Ukrainian souvenirs

3:00 PM - 5:00 PM

Live Performance
"Ukraine in our hearts"

Director: Victoria Vereskun

Ukrainian band "Two Violins"
with the participation of world-famous
14-year-old violinists
Illia Bondarenko and Tetiana Zhmendak

Famous Ukrainian opera singer
Oksana Stepanyuk

Children from Ukrainian School "Dzherelce"
Ukrainian folk and contemporary choreography
Folk songs performed by professional
and amateur performers from Tokyo

Location

Tokyo, Minato-ku, Akasaka 4-18-13
Akasaka Kumin Hall


Transportation

Subway Ginza Line, Marunouchi Line: get off at Akasaka Mitsuke Station and take Exit A (10-minute walk)
Subway Oedo Line, Ginza Line and Hanzomon Line: get off at Aoyama Itchome Station and take Exit 4 (10-minute walk)
Minato City Community Bus "Chi-Bus"
Akasaka bus route #44, get off at "Akasaka Chiku Sogo Shisho Mae" bus stop
Aoyama bus routes #44 and #125, get off at "Akasaka Chiku Sogo Shisho Mae" bus stop

There is no dedicated parking space for Akasaka Kumin Centre,
so please refrain from coming by car.




Ukrainian Community in Japan "Kraiany"
